name: Non-Disclosure Agreement
shortDescription: A Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) is an agreement in which one or more parties to an agreement agree not to disclose the confidential information.
description: A Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) is an agreement in which one or more parties to an agreement agree not to disclose the confidential information. NDAs protect intellectual property rights and sensitive information related to business and clients.

howWeWork.heading: How to get a Non Disclosure Agreement drafted

content.title: Schedule Call with the Lawyer
content.description: Schedule Call and discuss with the Lawyer your Document drafting requirements

content.title: Get your Agreement Draft
content.description: Lawyer will deliver customized draft of the Document as per your requirement

content.title: Dedicated Lawyer Available
content.description: 60 Minutes of Talk time with the Lawyer for discussing requirements and changes in the draft

content.title: First Draft within 3 Days
content.description: First draft of the Document will be delivered within a maximum of 3 working days

content.title: Finalize Document
content.description: 2/3 Iterations per Document allowed to incorporate your suggestions/changes

content.title: Scope of NDA
content.description: The NDA defines what confidential information is. It also specifies which part of the information is not confidential. Such information is detailed in a schedule and attached to the document.

content.title: Duration of agreement
content.description: The agreement outlines the period for which confidentiality is to be maintained. The recipient of the agreement has to uphold the secrecy of the information for the outlined time period. It could be one year or indefinite time.

content.title: Exceptions to confidentiality
content.description: The agreement lays down certain exceptions for the recipient party. These exceptions address certain circumstances where the recipient party has to disclose the confidential information.

content.title: Right to seek injunction
content.description: Right to injunction helps you receive a court order to prevent the other party from breaching the agreement.

content.title: Dispute Resolution clause
content.description: The NDA arbitration clause provides the parties a dispute resolution mechanism. The remedy on the breach by the Recipient party is clearly expressed in the arbitration clause of the Non-disclosure Agreement.

content.title: Jurisdiction clause
content.description: The agreement specifies in case of dispute which court will have jurisdiction. This clause helps the disclosing party avoid litigation cost.
The NDA protects trade secrets, proprietary rights and safeguards the interest of the disclosing party.
It precisely defines the confidentiality terms, which helps avoid ambiguity and litigation cost in case of disputes.
Non-Disclosure Agreement helps in achieving the purpose of the business by performing due diligence.

faqs.question: Does a Non-Disclosure Agreement need to be stamped?
faqs.answer: Yes, stamping is a necessary procedure for NDA. Without a stamp the document will not be accepted in court. The stamp duty on NDA may vary from state to state.

faqs.question: Is NDA enforceable in India?
faqs.answer: The NDA is a legally binding contract as it is governed by the Indian Contract Act, 1872. It is enforceable in India.

faqs.question: Do both the parties sign the NDA?
faqs.answer: Yes, both the parties should sign the agreement.

faqs.question: I have a Non-Disclosure Agreement; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your Non-Disclosure Agreement reviewed and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can upload your document and schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting the Agreement drafted from ezyLegal?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal offers Standard and Customized Document drafts. If you chose the customized Document option, your call will be scheduled with a Lawyer to whom you can explain your specific requirements. The first draft will be delivered within 2 working days and then you would be allowed 2-3 iterations to make changes in the draft.

faqs.question: How will the Document be delivered to me?
faqs.answer:
The Document when ready will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. You will be notified on email and WhatsApp whenever a new version of the Document is uploaded. You can Log-in and View or Download the document. 
Copy of the documents delivered by ezyLegal will always be available in your ezyLegal account forever.
